dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George touches his lips with his tongue, wipes his mouth  with his hand, laughs happily. His rapture knows no bound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (joyously) My mouth's bleeding, Bert! My mouth's  bleed... (feeling in watch  pocket) Zuzu's petals! Zuzu's... they're...   they're here, Bert! What do you know  about that? Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He practically embraces the astonished Bert, then runs at top speed toward town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George runs away from camera yelling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary! Mary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George's wrecked car is smashed against the tree. He come running into shot, sees the car, lets out a triumphant ye pats the car, and dashes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George sees that the "POTTERSVILLE" sign is now replaced the original "YOU ARE NOW IN BEDFORD FALLS" sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Bedford Falls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and runs through the falling snow up the main st of the town. As he runs, he notices that the town is back its original appearance. He passes some late shoppers on street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ad lib) Merry Christmas! Merry Christmas,  George!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, movie house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, emporium!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, you wonderful old  Building and Loan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George notices a light in Potter's office window, and rac across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potter is seated working at his desk, his goon by his sid George pounds on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from outside) Merry Christmas, Mr. Potter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George runs off as Potter looks up from his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy New Year to you В– in jail! Go  on home В– they're waiting for you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are on. There is a fire in the fireplace. The  Christmas tree is fully decorated with presents stacked  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carter, the bank examiner, a newspaper reporter and  photographer, and a sheriff, are waiting in the hall for  George. George comes dashing in the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excitedly) Mary... (sees the men) Well, hello, Mr. Bank Examiner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his hand and shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Mr. Bailey, there's a deficit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Eight thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reaching into pocket) George, I've got a little paper here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) I'll bet it's a warrant for my arrest.   Isn't it wonderful? Merry Christmas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photographer sets off a flash bulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reporters? Where's Mary? (calling) Mary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George runs to the kitchen. He gets no answer. As he goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look at this wonderful old drafty  house! Mary! Mary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes running back to the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, Daddy! Merry  Christmas, Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three children are at the top of the stairs. They are their pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George starts to run up the stairs, and the old familiar  knob on the banister comes off in his hand. He kisses it  lovingly and puts it back, then continues up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete В– kids В– Janie В– Tommy. (takes them in his  arms) I could eat you up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and the kids. He is hugging them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your mother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She went looking for you with Uncle  Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu comes running out of her bedroom. George crushes her him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu В– Zuzu. My little gingersnap!  How do you feel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And not a smitch of temperature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Not a smitch of temp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mary comes through the door, breathless and excited. T four men are watching with open mouths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hallelujah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the men) Hello. (sees George) George! Darling!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary races up the stairs, where George meets her in a fie embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary! Mary!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, darling! Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and Mary embrace tearfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, George, George, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary! Let me touch you! Oh, you're  real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, George, George!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what's happened to  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what happened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops her with a kiss. She leads him excitedly down th stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, come on, George, come on  downstairs quick. They're on their  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary leads George, who is carrying a couple of the kids o his back, to a position in front of the Christmas tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in here now. Now, you stand  right over here, by the tree. Right  there, and don't move, don't move. I  hear 'em now, George, it's a miracle!  It's a miracle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs toward front door and flings it open. Ad lib SOU of an excited crowd can be heard. Uncle Billy, face flush covered with snow, and carrying a clothes basket filled w money, bursts in. He is followed by Ernie, and about twen more townspeople.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in, Uncle Billy! Everybody! In  here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Billy Mary and the crowd come into the living room. table stands in front of George. George picks up Zuzu to  protect her from the mob. Uncle Billy dumps the basketful money out onto the table В– the money overflows and falls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it wonderful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest of the crowd all greet George with greetings and smiles.  Each one comes forward with money. In their pock in shoe boxes, in coffee pots. Money pours onto the table pennies, dimes, quarters, dollar bills В– small money, bu lots of it. Mrs. Bailey and Mrs. Hatch push toward George More people come in. The place becomes a bedlam. Shouts o "Gangway В– gangway" as a new bunch comes in and pours ou its money. Mary stands next to George, watching him. Geor stands there overcome and speechless as he holds Zuzu. As sees the familiar faces, he gives them sick grins.  Tears course down his face. His lips frame their names as he gr them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionally at the  breaking point) Mary did it, George! Mary did it!  She told a few people you were in  trouble and they scattered all over  town collecting money.  They didn't  ask any questions В– just said: "If  George is in trouble В– count on me."  You never saw anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom comes in, digging in his purse as he comes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, George? Another run on  the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie adds his money to the pile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are, George. Merry Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie is trying to get some system into the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line forms on the right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Martini comes in bearing a mixing bowl overflowing wi cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Martini! Merry Christmas! Step  right up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Martini dumps his money on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I busted the juke-box, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gower enters with a large glass jar jammed full of no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gower!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to George) I made the rounds of my charge  accounts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet Bick arrives, and takes out the money George had g her for her trip to New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet Bick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to go, George. I changed  my mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie, the colored maid, enters, digging money out of a l black stocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been saving this money for a  divorce, if ever I get a husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Partridge, the high school principal, is the next don

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you are, George. I got the  faculty all up out of bed. (hands his watch to  Zuzu) And here's something for you to play  with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving money) I wouldn't have a roof over my head  if it wasn't for you, George.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie is reading a telegram he has just received.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute. Quiet, everybody.  Quiet В– quiet. Now, this is from  London. (reading) Mr. Gower cables you need cash. Stop.  My office instructed to advance you  up to twenty-five thousand dollars.  Stop. Heehaw and Merry Christmas.  Sam Wainwright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd breaks into a cheer as Ernie drops the telegram top of the pile of money on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Mr. Martini. How about some wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As various members of the family bring out a punch bowl a glasses, Janie sits down at the piano and strikes a chord She starts playing "Hark! The Herald Angels Sing," and th entire crowd joins in the singing. We see a SERIES OF SHO of the various groups singing the hymn, and some people a still coming in and dropping their money on the table. Ca the bank examiner, makes a donation; the sheriff sheepish looks at George and tears his warrant in small pieces. In the midst of this scene, Harry, in Naval uniform, enters, accompanied by Bert, the cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, George, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry... Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he sees the money) Mary В– looks like I got here too  late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary, I got him here from the airport  as quickly as I could. The fool flew  all the way up here in a blizzard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Bailey enters scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, how about your banquet in New  York?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I left right in the middle of it  as soon as I got Mary's telegram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ernie hands Harry a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea, Ernie. A toast... to my  big brother, George. The richest man  in town!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once more the crowd breaks into cheering and applause. Ja at the piano and Bert on his accordion start playing "Aul Lang syne," and everyone joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George, still holding Zuzu in his arms, glances down at t pile of money on the table. His eye catches something on of the pile, and he reaches down for it. It is Clarence's copy of "Tom Sawyer." George opens it and finds an inscri written in it: "Dear George, remember no man is a failure who has friends. Thanks for the wings, Love Clarence."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at book) What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a Christmas present from a  very dear friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this moment, perhaps because of the jostling of some o the people on the other side of the tree, a little silver bell on the Christmas tree swings to and fro with a silve tinkle. Zuzu closes the cover of the book, and points to bell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Daddy. Teacher says, every  time a bell rings an angel gets his  wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) That's right, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up toward the ceiling and winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attaboy, Clarence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The voices of the people singing swell into a final cresc for the
